Description: George W. Bush
the governor of Texas and eldest son of the 41st president
George H. W. Bush
won the election
defeating incumbent Vice President Al Gore
The September 11 attacks
commonly known as 9/11
were four coordinated suicide terrorist attacks carried out by al-Qaeda against the United States on Tuesday
September 11
Republican incumbent President George W. Bush was re-elected
defeating Democratic Senator John Kerry from Massachusetts
Hurricane Katrina was a devastating Category 5 Atlantic hurricane that resulted in 1
392 fatalities and caused damage estimated between $97.4 billion to $145.5 billion in late August 2005
particularly in the city of New Orleans and its surrounding areas.
A U.S. resident originally from South Korea
killed 32 people and wounded 17 others with two semi-automatic pistols
The Democratic ticket of Barack Obama
the junior senator from Illinois
and Joe Biden
the senior senator from Delaware
defeated the Republican ticket of John McCain
the senior senator from Arizona
and Sarah Palin
the governor of Alaska
Incumbent Democratic President Barack Obama and his running mate
incumbent Vice President Joe Biden
were re-elected to a second term
Black Lives Matter is a decentralized political and social movement that seeks to highlight racism
discrimination
and racial inequality experienced by black people
and promote anti-racism. Its primary concerns are incidents of police brutality and racially motivated violence against black people.
Republican nominee Donald Trump defeated Democratic former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton in the presidential election
while Republicans retained control of Congress. This marked the first and most recent time Republicans won or held unified control of the presidency and Congress since 2004
The first COVID-19 case (confirmed via serological test) in the US was reported in Washington state on January 20
the same day as the first reported case in South Korea.
The George Floyd protests were a series of police brutality protests that began in Minneapolis in the United States on May 26
Democratic presidential nominee
former vice president Joe Biden
defeated incumbent Republican president Donald Trump in the presidential election
